discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Babasa09 is correct. I tested it on my Expressway and the match failed, so it would send it to the Traversal Zone. If you make the alias 1335 then there will be a successful match.

Answer D
For the response to be C, regex should be 1?3+58

None of the answers are correct. I dropped this all into the expression tester on an expressway in my lap, and it says that the pattern doesn't match. So, it would not be sent to the target zone, because it didn't match the pattern. The expressway would then continue to process the next search rule.
So am i to understand C is the correct answer then? as it will match 1335 then stop and replace the string with 135?? or is D correct as the 13358 as a whole string doesn't match??????
There is no match 13358 so this search rule will not be applied. I believe there is a typo.

comments.content:
I think these are valid matches:
35,335,33335,33335 etc.
135,1335,13335,133335 etc.
Because there is no way to get more then one 1 at the beginning. "?" says that the character before the "?" must be there 0 or 1 times.

discussion.content:
Based on LINK for Regex: https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2018/pdf/BRKCOL-2018.pdf
* 0 or more repetitions of previous character or expression
+ 1 or more repetitions of previous character or expression
? 0 or 1 repetitions of previous character or expression

Based on Website (https://www.regextester.com/10544) there are a few options which meets this Regex:

135, 1335, 13335, 1333335
1135, 11335, 113335, 11333335

no match for 13358: D is correct
This is all wrong it should be 1358 and send to traversal zone

comments.content: Because 13358 will not be matched by shown regex. 1335 will be matched.
Hi, why you are saying that it should be 1358? picture has a replace behavior without any append or something like that
Yep, i check pattern, and it will work if matching alias will be 1335 without 8 in the end of string

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. When configuring a search rule that routes calls to a zone, what occurs when 13358 is dialed?

choices.B: 13358 is replaced by 135 and remains in the same zone.
choices.A: 13358 is replaced by 135, and then is sent to the local zone.
choices.D: 13358 is sent directly to the traversal zone.
choices.C: 13358 is replaced by 135, and then is sent to the traversal zone.

discussion.content:
A is correct, but the pattern string should be:
(4\d{3})@exp-name.exp.domain(:.*)?

choices.B: It changes all patterns that begin with 4123@exp-name.exp.domain:<port> to 1@exp.domain

questions.question_text:

choices.D: Change the interworking mode to On.
choices.C: Disable SIP in the external zone.
choices.B: Change the domain of SIP endpoint A to cisco.com.

discussion.content:

D is correct

D seems correct.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/12_6/cjab_b_cloud-and-hybrid-deployments-cisco-jabber-12-6/cjab_b_cloud-and-hybrid-deployments-cisco-jabber-12-6_chapter_0101.html

choices.D: Add Jabber Users to the Cisco Webex Administration Tool.
choices.B: Add the Jabber user to Expressway-E.
choices.A: Add the Jabber user to Cisco Unity Connection.
choices.C: Add the Jabber user to Expressway-C.

questions.question_text: Which step is required when configuring cloud and hybrid deployments for Cisco Jabber?
Which two licenses are required for the B2B feature to work? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Traversal server and RMS. Any other is not needed. (Unless the calls needs Interworking, but that is not the case in this question).

Selected Answer: AC
• Rich Media Sessions: Determines the number of non-Unified Communications calls allowed on the Expressway (or Expressway cluster) at any one time. See the Call Types and Licensing section for more information.

• Traversal Server: Enables the Expressway to work as a firewall traversal server.

 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide/exwy_m_managing-licensing.html

Room system and desktop system registration licenses: These licenses are required for all devices that register to Cisco Expressway-C. Devices that consume a registration license will not consume a Rich Media license when they are in a call with any other Cisco registered device, Cisco Infrastructure product (for example, Cisco Meeting Server), or calls in the Cisco Collaboration Cloud.
BangBang86 wrote correct Answer 1 year ago and have 7 votes. Why administrator doesnt change the corrcet Answer to A and C?

comments.content: In the answer you have "Device Provisioning" not "Device Registration", so no this in NOT correct answer. The question asks what you need for B2B. No matter where the device is registered you need Traversal Server and RMS
